item.title: Making Extremes and Giving Effects (PI)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

EDIT: I misread the thread lol.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:427167”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=529866.msg3878764#msg3878764 date=1325860176]

  1. This is leeched.
  2. This is a snippet.
  3. If you get missing “symbols”, then you need to convert it to work with your base.
    [/quote]what do you mean convert? This is for project insanity. In all truthfulness though if a person can’t look at the current code and make a potion from that then what the hell are they doing on this forum…[/quote]

If people aren’t using PI then everything won’t be the same. Example:

c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1);

Might be something like

Engine.getClient.deleteItem(slot, amount, ect.)

I agree with you, but yet there’s people having trouble with this. I just had someone add my Skype asking for help with this.

Read full topic

what error?

item.title: Making Extremes and Giving Effects (PI)
item.dc:creator: @Brandon_Codes Brandon Codes
item.description:
@Brandon_Codes wrote:

Note: You must have extremes and overloads already in your server before doing this

Before we go any further, go to player.java and look for

and before the ;, add

Without doing this, you will get a million errors lol. (Not really like 2)

Now, go to useitem.java and add this somewhere

//Making Extremes and Overloads by Brandon (Brandon Codes on moparscape)// if (itemUsed == 261 && useWith == 2436 || itemUsed == 2436 && useWith == 261) { if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) { c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1); c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1); c.getItems().addItem(15308,1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore); } else { c.sendMessage("You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Attack (4)."); } } if (itemUsed == 267 && useWith == 2440 || itemUsed == 267 && useWith == 2440) { if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) { c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1); c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1); c.getItems().addItem(15312,1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore); } else { c.sendMessage("You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Strength (4)."); } } if (itemUsed == 259 && useWith == 2444 || itemUsed == 259 && useWith == 2444) { if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) { c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1); c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1); c.getItems().addItem(15324,1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore); } else { c.sendMessage("You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Ranging (4)."); } } if (itemUsed == 2481 && useWith == 2442 || itemUsed == 2481 && useWith == 2442) { if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) { c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1); c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1); c.getItems().addItem(15316,1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore); } else { c.sendMessage("You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Defense (4)."); } } if (itemUsed == 3000 && useWith == 3040 || itemUsed == 3000 && useWith == 3040) { if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) { c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1); c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1); c.getItems().addItem(15320,1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore); } else { c.sendMessage("You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Magic (4)."); } }
Now to explain.
“if (itemUsed == * && useWith == * || itemUsed == * && useWith == *) {” Basically means… “If you use (this item) and (this item) together” And then the { means “,”. If you know good English, this should kind be like grammar, but it’s grammar in Java. Similar to English ;p kinda.
“if(c.playerLevel[c.playerHerblore] >= 80) {” Basically means that it’s making sure the player has 80 herblore before making extremes.
“c.getItems().deleteItem(useWith, c.getItems().getItemSlot(useWith),1);” Means it’s deleting the item you used with the first item, and making the slot free.
“c.getItems().deleteItem(itemUsed, c.getItems().getItemSlot(itemUsed),1);” Means it’s deleting the first item that you used on the other item, and making the slot free.
“c.getItems().addItem(15308,1);” means it’s adding the outcome (The extreme potion) to your inventory.
“c.getPA().addSkillXP(40000 * Config.HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE, c.playerHerblore);”… this one’s kinda obvious. It means it’s giving you 40k herblore exp for making the potion
“} else {
c.sendMessage(“You need 80 Herblore to make Extreme Magic (4).”);” Means that if they DIDN’T have 80 herblore in the first place, that message will be sent to them, and no items will be deleted, and no items will be added.
“}
}” If you didn’t know, if you have one bracket, you have to close it. We had 2 brackets already opened, so we had to close them.

[size=14pt]Moving on to making the potions work![/size]
Go to your potions class and add this somewhere

//Making Extremes Work By Brandon (Brandon Codes on Moparscape)// case 15312: //Extreme Strength drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15313, slot, 2, false); break; case 15313: //Extreme Strength drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15314, slot, 2, false); break; case 15314: //Extreme Strength drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15315, slot, 2, false); break; case 15315: //Extreme Strength drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 229, slot, 2, false); break; case 15308: //Extreme Attack drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15309, slot, 0, false); break; case 15309: //Extreme Attack drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15310, slot, 0, false); break; case 15310: //Extreme Attack drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15311, slot, 0, false); break; case 15311: //Extreme Attack drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 229, slot, 0, false); break; case 15316: //Extreme Defence drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15317, slot, 1, false); break; case 15317: //Extreme Defence drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15318, slot, 1, false); break; case 15318: //Extreme Defence drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15319, slot, 1, false); break; case 15319: //Extreme Defence drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 229, slot, 1, false); break; case 15324: //Extreme Ranging drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15325, slot, 4, false); break; case 15325: //Extreme Ranging drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15326, slot, 4, false); break; case 15326: //Extreme Ranging drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15327, slot, 4, false); break; case 15327: //Extreme Ranging drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 229, slot, 4, false); break; case 15320: //Extreme Magic drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15321, slot, 6, false); break; case 15321: //Extreme Magic drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15322, slot, 6, false); break; case 15322: //Extreme Magic drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 15323, slot, 6, false); break; case 15323: //Extreme Magic drinkExtremePotion(itemId, 229, slot, 6, false); break;
These are pretty self explainatory. Basically making all of the extreme’s ID’s work.

Please leave CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM, this was my first tutorial!

Read full topic
